Name: Mall of America
Description: With 520 stores, 50 restaurants, and the nation's largest indoor theme park, Mall of America touts itself as "one of the most visited tourist destinations in the world."
Comment: Completed renovation of South Avenue December 2010.  East Broadway renovation to be completed 2011.  Radisson Blu Hotel under construction - will open fall 2012.

Name: Eastwood Mall Complex
Description: Eastwood Mall opened in 1969. With some 3,200,000 square feet of leasable space, its current anchor stores are JCPenney, Macy's, Sears, Target, and Dillard's.
Comment: Residence Inn by Marriott & Eastwood Banquet Center also on site.

Name: South Coast Plaza
Description: South Coast Plaza opened in 1967, and attracts some 24 million visitors per year. It bills itself as "The Ultimate Shopping Resort."
Comment: A 500,00 sq. ft. expansion planned.

Name: King of Prussia Mall
Description: King of Prussia Mall is owned by the Simon Property Group, and includes Nordstrom, Macy's Neiman Marcus, Bloomingdale's, Lord & Taylor stores.
Comment: Expansion will add another 140,000 Sq. Ft. The expansion will link the Plaza and Court components of the King of Prussia Mall. Center includes The Court, The Plaza, & The Pavilion.

Name: Millcreek Mall
Description: The Cafaro Company opened Millcreek Mall in 1975. The one-level mall was renovated in 2008.

Name: Celebrate Virginia
Description: The Central Park shopping complex is the retail centerpiece of Celebrate Virginia near Fredericksburg. It was developed by the Silver Companies.
Location: Carl D. Silver Pkwy. & Central Park Blvd.
Comment: Consists of three separate centers, Central Park/Marketplace/Town Center; a major mixed-use development.

Name: Del Amo Fashion Center
Description: The precursor to Del Amo opened in 1961. Anchor stores in this Simon-owned mall include JCPenney, Macy's, Sears, and Marshall's.
Comment: Mall contains 3 separate food courts and each has their own separate seating areas.

Name: Woodfield Mall
Description: Woodfield Mall opened in 1971. Anchor stores include Nordstrom, Macy's Lord & Taylor, JCPenney, and Sears.
Location: Woodfield Dr. SW of I-90 & IL 53

Name: The Houston Galleria
Description: The Galleria's central, vaulted space was modeled on the Galleria Vittorio Emanuale II in Milan, Italy. It is ranked as the largest mall in Texas.
Comment: The Houston Galleria is the southwest's premiere shopping center with over 300 shops and restaurants set beneath spectacular glass atriums.

Name: Palisades Center
Description: This four-level mall's anchor stores include JCPenney, Lord & Taylor, Macy's, Old Navy, and Target.
Comment: Palisades Center is a 3 in 1 property combining super regional mall, power center and entertainment center all in one building.

Name: Roosevelt Field Mall
Description: This mall stands on the site of the airfield from which Charles Lindbergh began his solo transatlantic flight. It hosts some 270 stores.

Name: Tysons Corner Center
Description: Tysons Corner Center opened in 1968, and was expanded in 2008. Nordstrom, Bloomingdale's, Lord & Taylor, and Macy's are its anchor stores.

Name: Plaza Las Americas
Description: Opened in 1968, Plaza Las Americas is the second largest shopping mall in Latin America. Anchor stores include JCPenney, Sears, and Macy's.

Name: Westfield Garden State Plaza
Description: When this mall opened in 1957, its inward-facing design around an open plaza was innovative. It is now New Jersey's largest shopping mall.

Name: Ala Moana Center
Description: This largest of Hawaii's shopping malls is also allegedly the world's largest open-air shopping center. It opened in 1959.

Name: Aventura Mall
Description: This three-level mall is the largest in Florida. Anchor stores include Nortstrom, Bloomingdale's, JCPenney, Macy's, and Sears.

Name: Lakewood Center
Description: Lakewood Center's 250 stores are anchored by JCPenney, Macy's Forever 21, and Target. It is owned and operated by The Macerich Company.

Name: Oakbrook Shopping Center
Description: Oakbrook opened in 1962 in a suburb of Chicago. It is now the largest open-air mall in the contiguous U.S., and is managed by General Growth Properties.

Name: Larkridge & Larkridge South
Description: Larkridge is a sprawling outdoor shopping complex that includes Sears, Costco, Dick's, and The Home Depot among its larger stores.
Comment: Larkridge & Larkridge South are open air power centers with major, small major and pedestrian style retailers.

Name: Gravois Bluffs Plaza
Description: Fenton, Missouri's Gravois Bluffs Plaza is a vast assemblage of big-box stores and other retailers, including Target, Kohl's, Wal-Mart, and Sears.
Comment: The GLA reflects the retail portion only. This project includes Summit at Gravois Bluffs.

Name: Chesterfield Commons
Description: Another sprawling outdoor complex, Chesterfield Commons hosts a Wal-Mart Supercenter, Best Buy, Dick's Sporting Goods, The Home Depot, Target, and many other retail outlets.

Name: University Town Center I & II
Description: This outdoor complex in Norman, Oklahoma includes a Target, TJ Maxx, Dress Barn, Petco, and other retail outlets.

Name: Pittsburgh Mills
Description: Pittsburgh Mills opened in 2005, and is the largest shopping complex in western Pennsylvania. It has two main components: The Galleria at Pittsburgh Mills, and the Village at Pittsburgh Mills.
Location: North Shore Dr. Allegheny Ave. & Federal St.
Comment: GLA reflects entire development. Mixed-use development between Heinz Field Stadium & PNC Park.

Name: NorthPark Center
Description: NorthPark Center opened in 1965; a 2006 expansion doubled its size. Anchors include Macy's, Nieman Marcus, and Nordstrom.

Name: Scottsdale Fashion Square
Description: Scottsdale Fashion Square opened in 1961 as an open-air mall. In 1982 it was connected to the adjoining Camelview Plaza by a bridge. It is now among the nation's most profitable shopping malls.

Name: Fashion Show
Description: Located on the Las Vegas Strip, the Fashion Show's anchor tenants include Dillard's, Forever 21, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, and Saks Fifth Avenue.
Location: Las Vegas Blvd. & Spring Mountain Rd.

Name: Sawgrass Mills
Description: Sawgrass Mills opened in 1990. After three expansions, it hosts more than 300 retail stores.
Location: NW 136 Ave., Sunrise Blvd. & Flamingo Rd.
Comment: Plans to add 180,000 Sq. Ft of retail.

Name: Gurnee Mills
Description: Gurnee Mills, a Simon-owned mall, is situated midway between Chicago and Milwaukee. It opened in 1991.

Name: Hanes Mall
Description: Winston-Salem's Hanes Mall opened in 1990. Its anchors incude Belk, Dillard's, Macy's, JCPenney, Sears, and H&M.
Comment: Largest center in North and South Carolina.

Name: CityScape
Description: CityScape occupies three blocks in central Phoenix, and includes residential, office, and hotel facilities as well as retail stores.

Name: Brazos Town Center
Description: The retail stores of Brazos Town Center are part of a larger development including residential homes and an office park. Stores include Target, The Home Depot, Kohls, and Best Buy.
Location: NWC & SWC U.S. Hwy. 59 & FM 762/Reading Rd.
Comment: Brazos Town Center is a master-planned 'life essential' town center integrating 180 acres of retail wtih 620 multi-family homes & a medical/professional officepark.

Name: Jordan Landing Shopping Center
Description: Jordan Landing Shopping Center is part of a vast mixed-use development including residential units and offices. Ground was broken in 1999.

Name: Westfield Old Orchard
Description: Old Orchard opened in 1956, and underwent a major expansion in 2007. Anchors include Bloomingdale's, Macy's, Lord & Taylor, L.L. Bean, and Nordstrom.

Name: Florida Mall
Description: The Florida Mall opened in 1986, and now hosts more than 250 stores, and is one of the largest single-level malls in the nation.
Location: Sand Lake Rd. & S. Orange Blossom Trail
Comment: A new lifestyle component was completed in 2009.

Name: Town Center at Boca Raton
Description: Opened in 1980, the Town Center at Boca Raton's anchor stores are Bloomingdale's, Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Nordstrom, and Saks Fifth Avenue.
Comment: Terrace at Town Center is a new lifestyle component at this center.

Name: Mall of Georgia
Description: Georgia's largest shopping mall is on three levels, and has more than 200 retail stores. A statue atop the mall honors Button Gwinnett, a signer of the Declaration of Independence.

Name: Natick Mall
Description: Formerly named the Natick Collection, the Center hosts more than 275 stores and is the largest mall in New England.
Comment: Formerly called the Natick Mall.

Name: Southlands Town Center
Description: Southlands is an outdoor center in Aurora, Colorado. Many stores face a four-block "Main street" and community plaza.
Comment: When completed Southlands will include more than 1100 residential units, 150,000 sq. ft. of office space & a Fairfield Inn.

Name: Gulf Coast Town Center
Description: Gulf Coast Town Center touts a "village-like setting" and hosts a variety of anchor stores, specialty shops, and restaurants.
Comment: Center is being built in phases.

Name: Northland Shopping Center
Description: One of the oldest shopping centers on the list, Northland opened in 1954. Macy's and Target currently serve as anchors.

Name: Crossgates Mall
Description: Crossgates Mall opened in 1984, and doubled its size ten years later. Anchors include Best Buy, Dick's Sporting Goods, JCPenney, and Macy's.

Name: Memorial City Mall
Description: Memorial City Mall opened in 1966 and underwent a major renovation in the early 2000s. Sears, Macy's, Target, and Dillard's are among its anchors.

Name: Fashion Valley Mall
Description: San Diego's largest mall is owned by the Simon Property Group. It opened in 1969 on the site of a baseball stadium.
Comment: Temporary tenants accepted year round.

Name: Freehold Raceway Mall
Description: The Freehold Raceway Mall opened in 1990. Its anchor stores are JCPenney, Lord & Taylor, Macy's, Nordstrom, and Sears.

Name: Westfield SouthPark
Description: Originally considered as a site for the Cleveland Browns by Art Modell, the mall opened in 1996 and is anchored by Dillard's Macy's, JCPenney, Sears, and Dick's Sporting Goods.

Name: Westfield Wheaton
Description: This two-level enclosed mall is owned by the Westfield Group. It opened in 1960 as an open-air mall.

Name: North East Mall
Description: Situated between Fort Worth and Dallas, North East Mall is anchored by several stores, including Dick's Sporting Goods, Dillard's, Macy's, Nordstrom, and Sears.

Name: Green Acres Mall
Description: Green Acres Mall was built in 1956 on the site of Curtiss Airfield. Its anchors include Macy's, JCPenney, Old Navy, Sears, and Kohl's.

Name: Woodbridge Center
Description: Formerly the site of clay pits, Woodbridge Center was developed by the Rouse Company, and is now owned by General Growth Properties.

Name: The Mall at Greece Ridge
Description: This mall began as Greece Towne Mall, which opened in 1968. In 1969 Long Ridge Mall opened ajdacent to it. The two facilities merged in 1994.
Location: Ridge Rd. W (Rte. 104) & Long Pond Rd.
